title: What are some examples of exoplanets? - Quora

response.answer_text: Exoplanets as the name suggests are those planets that are external to our own solar system,i.e.,they belong to either some other star system or come under the category of rogue planets. Nearly 2000 have been confirmed till date.  Here are some interesting ones: 1.Gamma cephei Ab: This was the first extra-solar planet discovered in 1998,but could be confirmed only in 2003 with the advent of better detection techniques. 2. Kepler 186f : The first earth-sized planet discovered by kepler mission in 2014. 3. CD-35 2722b : Most massive exoplanet till date. 70 light years away from earth and some 31 times more massive than jupiter.  4. OGLE-2005-BLG 390L : Located at a staggering 21000 light yeaars away from earth and is the coolest exoplanet to date with an average temperature of 50k. 5. Fomalhaut-b : This exoplanet takes 876 years to complete one orbit around its 200 million years old parent star. Almost as massive as jupiter. 6.55 Canceri-e : The densest one till date. Has density comparable to that of lead or about 9 times that of earth. But has a year lasting just 18 hours. 7. PSR-B1620-26b: The oldest one till date,dating about 13 billion years and located in globular cluster of M4. Nicknamed as “Methusuleh” planet. 8. HD-189773b : Glass rains continuously that too sideways. (Image source : google)

Currently we know of 2950 confirmed exoplanets (number is getting updated almost daily) and 2504 unconfirmed candidates. Constantly new discoveries are made. Here are just some highlights (obviously biased by my own work): In the last months the planets in the system TRAPPIST-1 got some attention: seven earth-sites planets, three of which are in the habitable zone: Ultracool Dwarf and the Seven Planets - Temperate Earth-sized Worlds Found in Extraordinarily Rich Planetary System Last year the European Southern Observatory found an earth-sizes planet orbiting our nearest star, Proxima Centauri: Planet Found in Habitable Zone Around Nearest Star - Pale Red Dot campaign reveals Earth-mass world in orbit around Proxima Centauri OGLE-2007-BLG-349 was the fist planet to be found using the so-called microlensing method: Hubble helps find light-bending world with two suns 55 Cancri e is the first super-Earth with a confirmed atmosphere: First Detection of Super-Earth Atmosphere Gliese 436b was found to get stripped its atmosphere of by its parent star: Hubble sees atmosphere being stripped from Neptune-sized exoplanet HAT-P-11b has signs of water vapour in its atmosphere: Clear skies on exo-Neptune - Smallest exoplanet ever found to have water vapour HD 189733b is the first planet with a confirmed colour - it is blue: Hubble spots azure blue planet - True colour of exoplanet measured for the first time Fomalhaut b is among the first exoplanets being imaged directly: Hubble directly observes planet orbiting Fomalhaut
